title: How to share Internet on Windows without a password (without security) - Quora

response.answer_text: Whether your internet service is shared with other people or not has nothing to do with your computer - it’s something that your “router” decides. So either your cable interface, or a wired router or a wireless WiFi router makes that decision. Generally, WiFi routers have a password - but those with Ethernet cable interfaces don’t. The idea being that you can physically prevent someone from plugging a cable into your router - but you can’t stop someone nearby from hooking up via WiFi. So go to your router’s firmware setup (this is different for every router manufacturer - for me, I point my browser to: 192.168.1.1 - and a web page pops up with the router’s interface on it…and from there, I can change how it’s set up…but yours may work differently. From there, you COULD just remove the WiFi password - then anyone in range of your router can get onto your internet. But that’s a very dangerous thing to do…if they have access to that - then they can reach any machine on your local network - including things like printers and other devices that have poor security. DO NOT DO THAT!!! Instead, most routers allow you to set up more than one WiFi “SSD” (the name of your network). Mine usual SSD is “cowshed” (long story!) - and that’s what I connect to (with a strong password). But for friends, I told my router to also allow access to “cowshed-GUEST” - which has a weak password that I tell my friends. The router is told NOT to allow people who access my Internet via “cowshed-GUEST” to communicate with any of the computers that enter via “cowshed”…but I could equally have made “cowshed-GUEST” have no password at all - which should allow members of the general public who happen to be in range of my house use my Internet for free with no password whatever. For me, that’s one step too far…but that’s up to you. Bottom line: It’s nothing to do with Windows - you need to read the router manual.

Follow these steps and you can have a hotspot  Open command prompt (in Admin mode)   2.Type : netsh wlan set hostednetwork mode=allow ssid=anything key=  Keep the key string empty if that is what you want , though I would strongly recommend you to have a key.   After that type in:        netsh wlan start hostednetwork    3.now that we have a hotspot ready       go to Network aand sharing center       it is in control panel > network and       internet > Network and sharing             center    4. Click on connection: Could be ethenet or wifi .(It will be highlighted ib blue)    5.click Properties    6.click on sharing    7. Tick on allow other network users to connect.On the dropdown list select Local area connection *# (in my case my virtual network was named like that but don't panic it will stand out from the rest)Select that click okay and tada!! You have now created a hotspot and you can connect various other devices.Hope i answerd your question.If you are stuck or i got your question wrong feel free to ask. Cheers!!
